intro: Aleurites, commonly known as the cannonball tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Sapotaceae. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and spherical, woody fruits that resemble cannonballs. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and ovate in shape. Aleurites species are native to tropical regions of the Americas and parts of Asia. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and have historical uses in traditional medicine and as a source of oil.
